DESCRIPTION: As a user I can open the Create Case dialog
TEST STEPS:
1. Navigate to Case Management page
2. Click the "Create New Case" button
3. Observe the dialog
EXPECTED RESULT: Create Case dialog opens as a modal overlay. Dialog displays all form fields: Title, Unit, Vehicle, System, Status, Priority, Description, Initial Meeting Minute, and Initial Record.

DESCRIPTION: As a user I can close the Create Case dialog using the X button
TEST STEPS:
1. Click "Create New Case" button
2. Observe the dialog is open
3. Click the X button in the top right corner of the dialog
EXPECTED RESULT: Dialog closes without creating a case. User returns to the Case Management page. No new case is created.

DESCRIPTION: As a user I can cancel case creation using the Cancel button
TEST STEPS:
1. Click "Create New Case" button
2. Fill in some fields
3. Click the "Cancel" button
EXPECTED RESULT: Dialog closes without creating a case. User returns to the Case Management page. No new case is created. Any entered data is discarded.

DESCRIPTION: As a user I can see validation when required fields are missing or invalid
TEST STEPS:
1. Click "Create New Case" button
2. Leave required fields empty
3. Click "Create Case" button
4. Observe validation messages
EXPECTED RESULT: Validation prevents case creation. Clear error messages or visual indicators show which fields are required or invalid. Case is not created until required fields are completed correctly.

DESCRIPTION: As a user I can see all dropdown fields populated with valid options
TEST STEPS:
1. Click "Create New Case" button
2. Click on Unit dropdown
3. Click on Vehicle dropdown
4. Click on System dropdown
5. Click on Status dropdown
6. Click on Priority dropdown
EXPECTED RESULT: All dropdown fields display appropriate options from the database. Unit shows available units, Vehicle shows available vehicles, System shows subsystems, Status shows available statuses (Open, Completed, Rejected), Priority shows priority levels.

DESCRIPTION: As a user I can successfully create a new case with all fields completed
TEST STEPS:
1. Click "Create New Case" button
2. Enter Title
3. Select Unit
4. Select Vehicle
5. Select System
6. Select Status
7. Select Priority
8. Enter Description
9. Enter Initial Meeting Minute
10. Enter Initial Record
11. Click "Create Case" button
EXPECTED RESULT: Case is created successfully. Dialog closes. User returns to Case Management page. New case appears in the case table. Summary counters update to include the new case. Success message may be displayed.

DESCRIPTION: As a user I can create a case with only required fields
TEST STEPS:
1. Click "Create New Case" button
2. Complete only required fields
3. Leave optional fields empty
4. Click "Create Case" button
EXPECTED RESULT: Case is created successfully with required fields populated. Optional fields are saved as empty/null. New case appears in the case table.

DESCRIPTION: As a user I can enter text in all free text fields
TEST STEPS:
1. Click "Create New Case" button
2. Click in the Title field and type text
3. Click in the Description field and type multi-line text
4. Click in the Initial Meeting Minute field and type multi-line text
5. Click in the Initial Record field and type multi-line text
EXPECTED RESULT: All text fields accept input. Title field accepts single-line text. Description, Initial Meeting Minute, and Initial Record fields accept multi-line text with line breaks preserved. Text is visible as typed.

DESCRIPTION: As a user I can see default values pre-populated in the form
TEST STEPS:
1. Click "Create New Case" button
2. Observe the Status and Priority fields
EXPECTED RESULT: Status field defaults to a sensible value (e.g., "New" or "Open"). Priority field defaults to a sensible value (e.g., "Medium"). Other fields may have defaults based on current filter selections.

FEATURE: Create Case - Vehicle Depends on Unit
DESCRIPTION: As a user I can see the Vehicle dropdown update based on selected Unit
TEST STEPS:
1. Click "Create New Case" button
2. Select a specific Unit
3. Open the Vehicle dropdown
EXPECTED RESULT: Vehicle dropdown shows only vehicles associated with the selected Unit. Vehicles are filtered appropriately.

FEATURE: Create Case - Case Appears in Table
DESCRIPTION: As a user I can see my newly created case appear in the case table
TEST STEPS:
1. Create a new case successfully
2. Observe the case table
EXPECTED RESULT: New case appears in the case table with all entered information displayed correctly (Title, Unit, Vehicle, System, Status, Priority, Date). Case is positioned appropriately in the table (e.g., at the top or sorted by date).

DESCRIPTION: As a user I can see summary counters update after creating a case
TEST STEPS:
1. Note current summary counter values
2. Create a new case with Status = "Open"
3. Observe summary counters
EXPECTED RESULT: Total counter increases by 1. Open counter increases by 1. Other status counters remain unchanged.
